meanings.definition: A table or data giving the positions of celestial bodies at regular intervals.
meanings.sent1: The ephemerides showed the exact location of the planets in the sky.
meanings.sent2: I always check the ephemerides to see where the stars will be tonight.
meanings.sent3: The ephemerides must have been confused because they said the moon was in my backyard!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a set of ephemerides, constantly tracking the movements of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The ephemerides were like a treasure map, guiding us through the vast universe.

meanings.sent1: I picked up the latest ephemerides to learn about the upcoming planetary alignments.
meanings.sent2: The ephemerides for this month arrived just in time for the astronomy club meeting.
meanings.sent3: The ephemerides magazine had a horoscope section that always made me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The ephemerides book was a beacon of knowledge in the sea of celestial mysteries.
meanings.sent5: The ephemerides publication was like a window into the secrets of the cosmos.
